sentences.sentence: “Now, Watson,” said Holmes, rubbing( 摩擦 ) his hands, “we have half an hour to ourselves. Let us make good use of( 利用 ) it.
My case is, as I have told you, almost complete; but we must not be over-confident.
Simple as the case seems now, there may be something deeper underlying( 在它下面 ) it.”
“Simple!” I shouted.
“Surely,” said he, somewhat in the manner of a professor( 教授 ) lecturing his class.
“Just sit in the corner there, that your footprints may not complicate( 使复杂 ) matters. Now to work!
In the first place, how did these people come, and how did they go? The door has not been opened since last night. How about the window?”
He carried the lamp across to it, muttering( 嘀咕 ) his observations aloud the while, but talking to himself rather than to me.
“Window is closed on the inner( 内部的 ) side. Framework( 框架 ) is solid. No hinges( 铰链 ) at the side.
Let us open it. No water-pipe near. Roof quite out of reach( 够不着 ). Yet a man has climbed up to the window. It rained a little last night. Here is a muddy footprint on the sill( 窗台 ).
And here is a circular muddy mark, and here again upon the floor, and here again by the table. See here, Watson! This is really a very pretty demonstration( 证明 ).”
I looked at the round, well-defined( 轮廓分明的 ) muddy circles. “This is not a footmark,” said I.
“It is something much more valuable to us. It is the impression of a wooden stump( 假腿 ).
You see here on the sill( 窗台 ) is the boot-mark, a heavy boot with the broad metal heel, and beside it is the mark of the wooden stump( 假腿 ).”
“It is the wooden-legged man.”
“Quite so. But there has been someone else—a very able and efficient( 高效的 ) ally( 盟友 ). Could you climb that wall, doctor?”
I looked out of the open window.
The moon still shone brightly on that angle of the house.
We were a good sixty feet from the ground, and wherever I looked, I could see no foothold( 踏脚处 ).
“It is absolutely impossible,” I answered.
“Without aid it is so. But suppose you had a friend up here who lowered you this strong rope which I see in the corner, fastening one end of it to this great hook in the wall.
Then, I think, if you were an active man, you might climb up, wooden leg and all.

You would leave, of course, in the same way, and your ally( 盟友 ) would draw up the rope, untie it from the hook, shut the window, close it on the inside, and get away in the same way that he originally came.
As a minor point it may be noted,” he continued, fingering the rope, “that our wooden-legged friend, though a good climber, was not a professional( 专业的 ) sailor.
His hands were soft.
My lens( 透镜 ) discloses( 揭露 ) more than one blood mark, especially towards the end of the rope, from which I gather that he slipped down with such speed that he took the skin off his hand.”
“But what about this mysterious( 神秘的 ) ally( 盟友 )? How did he get into the room?"
“Yes, the ally( 盟友 )!” repeated Holmes, pensively( 沉思地 ). “There are features( 特征 ) of interest about this ally( 盟友 ).
He lifts the case from the regions( 范围 ) of the commonplace( 常见的事 ).
I fancy that this ally( 盟友 ) breaks fresh ground( 开辟新天地 ) in the history of crime in this country—though there are similar cases from India and from Africa.”
“How did he get in, then?” I reiterated. “The door is locked, the window is inaccessible. Was it through the chimney?”
“It is much too small,” he answered. “I had already considered that possibility.”
“How then?” I persisted( 叮问道 ).
“You will not apply my rule,” he said, shaking his head.
“How often have I said to you that when you have eliminated( 排除 ) the impossible whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth?
We know that he did not come through the door, the window, or the chimney.
We also know that he could not have been hidden in the room, as there is no hiding place.
From where, then, did he come?”
“He came through the hole in the roof,” I cried.
“Of course he did. He must have done so.
If you will have the kindness to hold the lamp for me, we shall now extend our researches to the room above—the secret room in which the treasure was found.”
He mounted( 爬上 ) the steps, and, seizing a rafter( 椽子 ) with either hand, he swung himself up into the attic( 阁楼 ).
Then, lying on his face, he reached down for the lamp and held it while I followed him.
The room in which we found ourselves was about ten feet one way and six the other.
The floor was formed by the rafters, with thin lath( 木板条 )-and-plaster( 石灰 ) between, so that in walking one had to step from rafter( 椽子 ) to rafter( 椽子 ).
The roof ran up to a peak( 顶点 ), and was evidently the inner( 内部 ) shell( 框架 ) of the true roof of the house.
There was no furniture of any sort, and the dust of years lay thick upon the floor.
“Here you are, you see,” said Sherlock Holmes, putting his hand against the sloping( 倾斜 ) wall. “This is a trap door( 通气门 ) which leads out on to the roof.
I can press it back, and here is the roof itself, sloping( 倾斜 ) at a gentle angle.
This, then, is the way by which Number One entered. Let us see if we can find any other traces( 踪迹 ) of him.”
He held down the lamp to the floor, and as he did so I saw for the second time that night a startled( 受惊吓的 ) look come over his face.
For myself, as I followed his gaze( 凝视的目光 ) my skin was cold under my clothes.
The floor was covered thickly with the prints of a naked( 赤裸的 ) foot—clear, well defined( 轮廓清晰的 ), perfectly formed, but scarcely half the size of those of an ordinary man.
“Holmes,” I said, in a whisper, “a child has done the horrid( 可怕的 ) thing.”
He had recovered his self-possession( 镇静 ) in an instant( 马上 ).
“I was staggered( 吃惊的 ) for the moment,” he said, “but the thing is quite natural.
My memory failed me, or I should have been able to predict it.
There is nothing more to be learned here. Let us go down.”

article_info.previous: Holmes和Watson透过钥匙孔窥见了Mr. Bartholomew可怕的模样，撞开房门后，死亡现场又一次出现了“四签名”的记号，宝藏也不翼而飞，Holmes叫Mr. Thaddeus先去报警。
article_info.share_words: This is a trap door which leads out on to the roof. I can press it back, and here is the roof itself, sloping at a gentle angle. This, then, is the way by which Number One entered. Let us see if we can find any other traces of him.

question.cn: 泥巴印迹有什么特别之处吗？
question.en: What was special about the muddy mark?

options.cn: 它只被发现出现在窗台上。
options.en: It was only found on the sill.
It was not at all clear.

options.cn: 它是木桩假腿留下的痕迹。
options.en: It was the mark of a wooden stump.

analysis: 文中提到：“I looked at the round, well-defined muddy circles.‘This is not a footmark,’said I.‘It is something much more valuable to us. It is the impression of a wooden stump. You see here on the sill is the boot-mark, a heavy boot with the broad metal heel, and beside it is the mark of the wooden stump.’”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 根据Holmes的说法，木桩腿的男子是如何爬上这扇窗户的？
question.en: According to Holmes, how did the wooden-legged man climb up to the window?

options.cn: 他非常擅长攀登所以是他自己爬墙上来的。
options.en: He was such a good climber that he climbed up the wall on his own.

options.cn: 他借助于一根强有力的绳子才能爬上来。
options.en: He made it with the aid of a strong rope.

options.cn: 他要做到这件事绝对是不可能的。
options.en: It was absolutely impossible for him to do that.

analysis: 文中Holmes解释道：“But suppose you had a friend up here who lowered you this strong rope which I see in the corner, fastening one end of it to this great hook in the wall. Then, I think, if you were an active man, you might climb up, wooden leg and all. ”因此答案选B。

question.cn: Holmes通过观察绳子还推断出什么呢？
question.en: What else did Holmes conclude from his observation of the rope?

options.cn: 木桩腿的男子曾是个职业水手。
options.en: The wooden-legged man used to be a professional sailor.

options.cn: 木桩腿的男子还在房子里面。
options.en: The wooden-legged man was still inside the house.

options.cn: 木桩腿的男子滑下去的时候太快了而擦破了手。
options.en: The wooden-legged man slipped down so fast that he took the skin off his hand.

analysis: 文中提到：“. . . that our wooden-legged friend, though a good climber, was not a professional sailor. His hands were soft. My lens discloses more than one blood mark, especially towards the end of the rope, from which I gather that he slipped down with such speed that he took the skin off his hand.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 是什么使得这桩案件变得不再寻常？
question.en: What was it that lifted the case from the regions of the commonplace?

analysis: 文中Holmes说道：“There are features of interest about this ally. He lifts the case from the regions of the commonplace.I fancy that this ally breaks fresh ground in the history of crime in this country—though there are similar cases from India and from Africa.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 这个盟友是如何进入房间的？
question.en: How did the ally get into the room?

options.en: Through the hole in the roof.

analysis: 文中提到：“We know that he did not come through the door, the window, or the chimney. We also know that he could not have been hidden in the room, as there is no hiding place. . . He came through the hole in the roof. ”因此答案选B。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第29天
